note_text:
Indication: Malignant effusion (Breast CA).
Procedure: US-guided pigtail (10Fr).
Site: Right 8th ICS.
Action: Seldinger technique. 1464mL serosanguinous fluid drained.
Result: No PTX on CXR.
Plan: Floor admission.

registry_entry.institution_name: University of Michigan Hospital, Ann Arbor, MI

code_rationales.32557: Ultrasound-guided pleural drainage catheter (10Fr) placement via Seldinger technique.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Correctly coded as 32557 given ultrasound guidance and catheter technique.

note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Ultrasound-Guided Thoracentesis with Catheter Placement.
The patient presented with a symptomatic malignant pleural effusion secondary to breast carcinoma. Real-time ultrasonography was utilized to identify a safe pocket in the right 8th intercostal space. Under sterile conditions, a 10Fr pigtail catheter was introduced using the Seldinger technique. Approximately 1.4L of serosanguinous fluid was evacuated. Post-procedure imaging confirmed appropriate positioning.

code_rationales.32550: Insertion of tunneled pleural catheter (Aspira) for malignant effusion.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Correctly coded as 32550 for IPC insertion; imaging guidance is bundled.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Insertion of Tunneled Indwelling Pleural Catheter.
Mr. Ramirez underwent palliative catheter placement for a recurrent malignant effusion. Following ultrasound localization, a subcutaneous tunnel was created on the right chest wall. The Aspira catheter was introduced into the pleural cavity via a separate counter-incision. 2.3L of turbid fluid was evacuated. The cuff was positioned appropriately within the tunnel.

code_rationales.32551: Tube thoracostomy (28Fr) via blunt dissection technique.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Correctly coded as 32551 for large-bore chest tube placement via blunt dissection.

note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Tube Thoracostomy.
Ms. Perez presented with a complicated left parapneumonic effusion. Bedside ultrasound confirmed specific location. Under local anesthesia, a 28Fr chest tube was inserted into the 5th intercostal space utilizing a blunt dissection technique. Immediate return of 1686 mL of turbid fluid was noted. The tube was secured and connected to a Pleur-evac system.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Placement of Pleural Drainage Catheter.
Mr. Moore required drainage of a left-sided hepatic hydrothorax. The 5th intercostal space was identified by anatomic landmarks. A 14Fr pigtail catheter was placed using the Seldinger technique without real-time imaging. 996 mL of fluid was evacuated. Complications: None.

note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Emergent Tube Thoracostomy.
Mr. Harris developed an iatrogenic pneumothorax post-procedure. A 24Fr chest tube was inserted into the right 5th intercostal space using blunt dissection. A significant rush of air was appreciated upon pleural entry, and the tube demonstrated fogging with respiration. The tube was secured and placed to suction.
